 <li><strong>. . . </strong> is on average 74 cm × 76 cm 29 in × 30 in and are 38 cm 15 in high Badgers dig and collect bedding throughout the year particularly in autumn and spring Sett maintenance is usually carried out by subordinate sows and dominant boars The sett<strong>  . . .</strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> a badger dies within a sett chamber its conspecifics will seal off the chamber and dig a new one Some badgers will drag their dead out of the sett and bury them outside A sett is almost invariably located near a tree which is used by badgers for<strong>. . . </strong></li>

 </ul>
